Hi everyone, I have a question regarding the contacts API. We currently have a custom form on our website being filled out, and upon submission we call the contacts API to create a new contact in HubSpot.

However, the missing piece here is that the "Original Source" value will always be set to "Offline sources" with this implementation, but we need to be able to see what the referring link was for our marketing activity attribution.

I found some <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|documentation> where they attached the cookie value to a contact by calling the 'identify' function (ties email address to cookie), and then another call to 'trackPageView' or 'trackCustomBehavioralEvent' function (pushes this new tie to HubSpot). We've just implemented this solution to no avail, has anyone run into a similar situation or does anyone have some insight into a solution?
You can only if you are the owner of the app, you will find logs on your developer account.
Thank you Aldo!

Hey <@U07BRRJHXRA> It might not be relevant, But have you thought about injecting the HubSpot tracking code in your website. That will help creating the contacts whenever someone submits a form. By using this method, You will be able to track the contact sources.

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>
Hey Harry, Can you please share the error details if possible.

The HubSpot tracking code already exists on the page. So a "HubSpotutk" cookie is being set in the users browser, but just not being associated with them as a contact in the UI on the form submission.
